The '2010 [[National League Division Series]]' ('NLDS') were two best-of-five
game series to determine the participating teams in the 2010 National League
Championship Series. The three divisional winners and a fourth teamâa "Wild
Card"âplayed in two series from October 6 to 11. TBS televised all games in the
United States. [http://mlb.mlb.com/mlb/schedule/ps.jsp?y=10 2010 MLB
Postseason Schedule]

Under MLB's playoff format, no two teams from the same division were matched up
in the Division Series, regardless of whether their records would normally
indicate such a matchup. Home field advantage went to the team with the better
regular-season record with the exception of the wild card team, which defers
home field advantage regardless of record. The matchups were:
* (1) Philadelphia Phillies (Eastern Division champions, 97â65) vs. (3)
  Cincinnati Reds (Central Division champions, 91â71): Phillies won the
  series, 3â0.
* (2) San Francisco Giants (West Division champions, 92â70) vs. (4) Atlanta
  Braves (Wild Card qualifier, 91â71): Giants won the series, 3â1.

The Phillies and Reds had met in the postseason once before: in the 1976 NLCS,
which the Reds won 3â0. The Giants and Braves also had one prior postseason
seriesâthe 2002 NLDSâwhich the Giants won 3â2.
